means: 发出砰的一声，砰砰作响，砰地敲[推，扔]
[地名] [尼日利亚、中非共和国] 邦

sentence.Network_en: Dig a largish hole and bang the stake in first.
sentence.Network_cn: 挖一个大点儿的洞，先把木桩敲进去。

sentence.Network_en: Of course, slap-bang in the middle of town the rents are high.
sentence.Network_cn: 当然啦，市区正中心的租金是很高的。

sentence.Network_en: The trade secretary disagreed but promised to "bang the drum for industry".
sentence.Network_cn: 贸易部长并不同意，但是答应会“为产业界摇旗呐喊”。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...后把这个字符串传给了数据库，数据库会先对authors表进行查询，然后把我们的pubs数据库删除。“砰（bang）“的一声，数据库就没了！

自从发现大霹雳(Big Bang)以及宇宙扩张的理论后,我们知道宇宙的任何粒子,都处在恒动的现象,我们之所以毫无感觉,原因来自于惯性作 …

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly US)value for money; performance for cost
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式， 主 美)花钱换得价值

jx.jx_en_mean: used to express the sudden or complete destruction of a plan or ambition

lj.lj_ly: my first thought when I heard the news was ‘Bang goes my knighthood!’.
lj.lj_ls: 我听到那个消息第一反应是“我封不了爵士了！”。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英， 非正式)完全正确；完全符合

lj.lj_ly: the programme is bang on about the fashion world.
lj.lj_ls: 那节目完全符合时装界情况。

lj.lj_ly: the programme is bang on about the fashion world.
lj.lj_ls: 那节目完全符合时装界情况。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)derive excitement or pleasure from
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式， 主 北美)从…中得到刺激或乐趣

lj.lj_ly: some people get a bang out of reading that stuff.
lj.lj_ls: 有些人从看那东西中得到乐趣。

lj.lj_ly: the remark brought me down to earth with a bang.
lj.lj_ls: 那句话突然把我带回了现实。

lj.lj_ly: the day starts with a bang—the steep climb to the mountain top.
lj.lj_ls: 艰难登顶——那一天就这样惊心动魄地开始了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)do something in a persistent or dogged way

lj.lj_ly: he was banging away at his novel.
lj.lj_ls: 他正为自己的小说不懈努力。

lj.lj_ly: the government banged on about competition, efficiency, and the free market.
lj.lj_ls: 政府喋喋不休大谈竞争、效率和自由市场。

phrase.cizu_name: bang something out informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: play music or a tune noisily, enthusiastically, and unskilfully
jx.jx_cn_mean: 响亮而不熟练地奏（音乐）

jx.jx_en_mean: produce something hurriedly or in great quantities

lj.lj_ly: they weren't banging out ads in my day the way they are now.
lj.lj_ls: 我那个年代他们可没像今天这样拼命做广告。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英， 非正式)把（某人）关进监狱

lj.lj_ly: they've been banged up for something they didn't do.
lj.lj_ls: 他们以莫须有的罪名被关进监狱。

jx.jx_en_mean: To assail insistently, especially with questions.
To work diligently and often at length
jx.jx_cn_mean: 努力地通常是长久地工作

lj.lj_ly: banged away at the project until it was finished.
lj.lj_ls: 在项目完成前一直埋头苦干

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: imitative, perhaps of Scandinavian origin; compare with Old Norse bang 'hammering'

entry.def: A bang is a sudden loud noise such as the noise of an explosion.

example.ex: I heard four or five loud bangs...
She slammed the door with a bang...

entry.def: If something bangs, it makes a sudden loud noise, once or several times.

example.tran: 发动机爆出火花，接着发出砰的巨响。

entry.def: If you bang a door or if it bangs, it closes suddenly with a loud noise.

example.ex: All up and down the street the windows bang shut...
example.tran: 整条街的窗户都砰然关上了。

entry.def: If you bang on something or if  you bang it, you hit it hard, making a loud noise.

example.ex: We could bang on the desks and shout till they let us out...
example.tran: 我们可以拍着桌子大喊大叫，直到他们放我们出去。

example.ex: There is no point in shouting or banging the table.
example.tran: 叫嚷或者拍桌子都毫无意义。

entry.tran: （因生气而）砰地放下，猛然放下
entry.def: If you bang something on something or if you bang it down, you quickly and violently put it on a surface, because you are angry.

example.ex: She banged his dinner on the table...
example.tran: 她把他的饭菜砰地摔在了桌子上。
他砰的一声挂断了电话。

entry.def: If you bang a part of your body, you accidentally knock it against something and hurt yourself.

example.ex: She'd  fainted and banged her head...
example.tran: 她晕倒了，把脑袋给磕了。

example.ex: He hurried into the hall, banging his shin against a chair in the darkness.
example.tran: 他匆匆步入大厅，黑暗中小腿撞到了一把椅子上。

entry.tran: （通常指由于未能注意到眼前的人或物）撞上
entry.def: If you bang into something or someone, you bump or knock them hard, usually because you are not looking where you are going.

example.ex: I didn't mean to bang into you...
Various men kept banging into me in the narrow corridor.
example.tran: 在这条狭窄的走廊上，不断有人撞到我。

entry.def: Bangs are hair which is cut so that it hangs over your forehead.

example.ex: My bangs were cut short, but the rest of my hair was long.
example.tran: 我剪短了刘海，但其他地方的头发还是很长。

entry.def: You can use bang to emphasize expressions that indicate an exact position or an exact time.

example.ex: ...bang in the middle of the track...
For once you leave bang on time for work.
example.tran: 你终于有一次准点上班去了。

entry.def: If you say bang goes something, you mean that it is now obvious that it cannot succeed or be achieved.

example.ex: There will be more work to do, not less. Bang goes the fantasy of retirement at 35.
example.tran: 工作只会增加，不会减少。梦想着35岁退休是彻底没戏了。

entry.tran: 精力充沛地；热情高涨地；非常成功地
entry.def: If something begins or ends with a bang, it begins or ends with a lot of energy, enthusiasm, or success.

example.ex: Her career began with a bang in 1986.

sentences.sentence: "he took a bash right in his face"
"he got a bang on the head"

means.word_mean: 3. a fringe of banged hair (cut short squarely across the forehead)
4. the swift release of a store of affective force;

sentences.sentence: "they got a great bang out of it"
"he got a quick rush from injecting heroin"
"that song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career"
"that new Broadway show is a real smasher"

means.word_mean: 2. to produce a sharp often metallic explosive or percussive sound;

sentences.sentence: "One of them banged the sash of the window nearest my bed"
"The old man banged around the house"
"This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm"
"Were you ever intimate with this man?"

list.explanation: 以十分艳丽或令人振奋的方式，很神气地，非常成功地

example.en: The party started off with a bang.
example.zh: 晚会是以十分振奋人心的方式开幕的。

example.en: The thing succeeded with a bang.

auth_sentence.content: It is not compatible with the Big Bang theory.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is not compatible with the Big Bang theory.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is not compatible with the Big Bang theory.

auth_sentence.content: So the big bang is not a solution either.
auth_sentence.res_content: So the big bang is not a solution either.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So the big bang is not a solution either.

auth_sentence.content: Why do we assume there was one Big bang?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why do we assume there was one Big bang?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why do we assume there was one Big bang?

Sentence.sentence: Civilization,then,is fine — people banging away on their smartphones are fluently using a code separate from the one they use in actual writing, and there is no evidence that texting is ruining composition skills.
NASA is developing a series of robotic probes that will get the most bang from a buck.
Why do local animal rights people bang on pots and pans?

sentences.en: She fell and got a nasty bang on the knee.
sentences.cn: 她摔倒了, 膝盖猛撞在地上。

sentences.en: The door shut with a bang.

jushi.english: The publication of the new magazine has made less of a bang than the publishers hoped for.
jushi.chinese: 新杂志的出版引起的回响不如出版者所期望的那样强烈。

jushi.english: The door shut with a bang.
She fell and got a nasty bang on the knee.
jushi.chinese: 她摔倒了,膝盖猛撞在地上。
